title: I am not allowed to win after getting promoted
body: Just got from bronze 2 back into 1 for the 6th or so time. First game I play, we lose. This happens every time. I looks at these people's ranks, and they are the same or lower than mine, yet they play like fucking gold+ players making my games impossible to win. Why is this? Why is it that bronze 2 feels like bronze 5, but bronze 1 feels like fucking plat 1?

replies.body: Division 1 rankings are always more difficult due to people being close to the next rank and trying much harder than they normally would. What you're experiencing is what Silver 2-5 play is like rather than gold-plat. Once you can jump that hump you can start your slow climb to s1 where it suddenly gets harder again.

I don't think I will be able to "jump that hump" anytime soon because these players are god-tier in comparison to me. I don't know, maybe my team and I just weren't playing well in all of these games.

I've been in a similar situation to you this season, bouncing between gold 3 and 4. Just can't seem to get wins going once I get promoted. It's possible that it's bad luck, but I think it's also psychological. You know you belong in at least Bronze 1 - you've already made it, many times. So getting back is (relatively) easy. You've been there and done that.

But once you're there, you NEED to win to avoid demotion. At least for me, those first few games after promotion are actually MORE stressful! I'm trying so hard to prove myself, to prove that I belong. And that makes me play worse - maybe it's the same for you?

My suggestion is to not think of it in wins/losses, but in knowledge gained. Even when you lose, you're gaining experience, and that makes you better. And soon, you're going to surpass the people you're getting matched up with, and you'll start winning more than you lose, and climbing up. If you're bouncing around those divisions now, then you're probably right on the cusp.

So keep at it, keep learning, and keep your head up. I bet you'll jump it sooner than you expect. =)

GL HF!

Here is some quick advice for B1:

1. Pick ONE champion that is extremely versatile (I used Annie). I would play Annie: Mid, APC, Support, or Top. Only Jungle I would have to switch up to a back-up.

2. MASTER that champion; play nothing but.

3. Focus more on not-dying than getting fed. Especially in Bronze this can be a game changer. Focus more on CS then getting killed. If you don't feed and farm you will be a late game powerhouse; and there WILL be a late game since you didn't feed.

4. Once game hits the 20 min mark make sure you are always with your team. Those 4v5 fights cause "that one guy was farming top" can end games very quickly.


Good luck!

Honestly, it's just bad luck. That's simply not how matchmaking works - you don't get matched only with B1 because you are B1, or only with B2 because you are B2. You get matched based on your hidden matchmaking rank. You still get the same games that you would after the same wins and losses regardless of rank. Some people get failed series or quick demotions out of bad luck often enough to be regularly matched with/against people several ranks higher (a full division would be extreme, but 1-2 levels isn't). If you keep win more than you lose your MMR will go up. If your MMR goes up, you gain more LP for wins and lose less for losses - it's even if you have the average MMR for you rank, disadvantaged if you have a lower MMR than your rank, advantaged if you have a higher than average MMR for your rank. Better MMR = easier climbing (if you can still win).
